intro: Amphithalea phylicoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sand everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically pale yellow to reddish in color. The plant produces achenes, which are dry, one-seeded fruits that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas with low rainfall. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
